p: Finally, the root extract was used to test the susceptibility of R. ferrugineus larvae at the concentrations of 2.8, 4.2, 6.0, 7.0 and 8.0 ppm. Results showed that percentage of mortalities were as follows; 35, 40, 45, 50 and 70, respectively ( Table 2, Fig. 2). The concentrations reflected an LC 50 of 7.00 ppm, and LC 95 of 13 ppm. The lowest concentration (2.8 ppm) produced 35% mortality, whereas the highest concentration (8 ppm) reflected 70% mortality and the R-square was 0.96.
